description: Japanese Cedar is an amazing plant species, native to Japan and other parts of East Asia. This evergreen tree is widely known for its ability to tolerate cold temperatures and its fast growth rate, reaching heights of up to 135 feet. Its traditional dark green needles are often curved, giving it an elegant and sophisticated look. Japanese Cedar has a light, aromatic smell and its wood is widely used for making furniture, internal structures, and carvings. Not only is Japanese Cedar a beautiful sight both in the wild and in gardens, but it is also a multipurpose, easy to care for tree that can be a great choice for ornamental landscaping. Its year round color and stunning silhouette make it a truly amazing plant species.
